intro: Thelecarpus soyauxii, commonly known as the African orchid, is a member of the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is native to tropical Africa. It is a terrestrial herb with a short, upright stem and a single, showy flower that typically blooms in the summer. The plant has a fibrous root system and thrives in moist, well-drained soils under shaded conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow with a distinctive lip, and it is valued for its ornamental appeal. Thelecarpus soyauxii is often found in forest understories and is relatively rare in cultivation.
